text: The Brisbane Cricket Ground, commonly known as the Gabba, is a major sports stadium in Brisbane, the capital of Queensland, Australia. It has hosted many different sports including athletics, Australian rules football, baseball, concerts, cricket, cycling, rugby league, rugby union, soccer and pony and greyhound racing. From October to March, the stadium hosts cricket matches. The Queensland cricket team and the Brisbane Heat play home matches at the stadium. It is also the home ground of the Brisbane Lions during the Australian Football League (AFL) season. It will be the main hub for the 2032 Summer Olympics. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1890s establishments in Australia Category:1895 establishments Category:Brisbane Category:Sports buildings in Australia Category:Stadiums
title: The Gabba
